item.description: Capital Group CEO Mike Gitlin said investors are eyeing diversification away from the US given the compelling opportunities elsewhere, and the risks stemming from geopolitics and supply-chain disruptions.
item.dc:creator: Haram Lim, Jaehyun Eom

item.title: Trump Threatens Musk as Senate Pulls All-Nighter on Tax Bill | Bloomberg The Pulse 07/01
item.description: Donald Trump again threatened to withdraw government subsidies from Elon Musk’s companies after the Tesla CEO ratcheted up his criticism of the president’s tax and spending bill. Trump wrote on Truth Social that Musk “may get more subsidy than any human being in history, by far,” and that without government support, “Elon would probably have to close up shop and head back home to South Africa.” Musk has posted dozens of times since Senate Republicans unveiled a new version of their tax-cut package Saturday that expedited the end of a popular $7,500 consumer tax credit for electric vehicle purchases. Meanwhile, Senate Republican leaders are continuing to scrounge for votes to pass the $3.3 trillion bill. Today's guests: Adam Posen, Peterson Institute for International Economics President, Dan Draper, S&P Dow Jones Indices CEO, Lorenzo Bini Smaghi, Société Générale Chairman (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: US Stock Futures Slip After Successive Records: Markets Wrap
item.description: US equity futures retreated slightly after the S&P 500 notched its best quarter since 2023, as investors monitor progress on trade talks and wrangling in Washington over President Donald Trump’s tax bill.
item.dc:creator: Andre Janse Van Vuuren, Julien Ponthus

item.title: Musk Bashes Spending Bill, Trump Threatens Tesla Subsidies
item.description: President Donald Trump threatened once again to withdraw government subsidies from Elon Musk’s companies after the Tesla Inc. chief executive officer criticized Trump’s tax and spending bill. Tyler Kendall reports on Bloomberg Television. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Malaysia’s Central Bank Says Ringgit Is Market-Determined
item.description: Bank Negara Malaysia said the ringgit’s exchange rate is market-determined and that the central bank’s derivative positions are used to manage liquidity conditions.

item.title: Homes Are Taking Longer to Sell in US Market That Once Flourished
item.description: A buildup of unsold houses sitting on the market for weeks is becoming a new reality in once-booming housing areas across the Sun Belt.
item.dc:creator: Michael Sasso

item.title: Goldman Says US Stock Rally to Continue Before Fading in August
item.description: The S&P 500 will add to its rally this month, spurred higher by improving liquidity, collapsing volatility, fading recession fears and seasonal factors, and then start to fade, according to flow specialists at Goldman Sachs Group Inc.
item.dc:creator: Jan-Patrick Barnert

item.title: Treasury Yields Drop to Lowest Level in Two Months Before Powell Speaks
item.description: US Treasury yields fell to the lowest level in two months before Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell speaks Tuesday, amid growing political pressure to cut interest rates.
item.dc:creator: Naomi Tajitsu

item.title: Euro-Zone Inflation Ticks Higher to Match ECB’s 2% Target
item.description: Euro-area inflation settled at the European Central Bank’s target in June, strengthening arguments to press pause on a year-long campaign of interest-rate cuts.
item.dc:creator: Jana Randow

item.title: Euro on Cusp of Best Winning Streak in Two Decades Versus Dollar
item.description: The euro is on the verge of its longest winning streak against the dollar in more than two decades — and options traders are betting the rally isn’t over yet.
item.dc:creator: Vassilis Karamanis

item.title: Hedge Funds Pile In as Big US Banks Soar to All-Time Highs
item.description: US lenders are on a tear and hedge funds are snapping up shares at a furious pace, underscoring Wall Street’s increasing conviction that their record-breaking rally has more room to run.

item.title: Oil Steadies as Market Girds for OPEC+ Production Quota Decision
item.description: Oil steadied around the lowest level since early June, with the focus turning to how much OPEC+ will increase output quotas this weekend.

Saudi Arabia is seeking to transform its crude-dependent economy by developing new industries, and is pushing into petrochemicals as a way to earn more from its energy deposits.

item.title: Gold Helps Canada’s Stocks Benchmark Outshine the S&P 500
item.description: Despite ongoing trade tensions and a weakening economy, Canada’s main stocks benchmark outshone its US counterpart in the first half thanks to a record-breaking gold rally.

item.title: China Vows to Rein In Intense Competition, Build Unified Market

item.title: Posen Says Tariffs 'Already Hitting' US Auto Industry
item.description: Adam Posen, president of the Peterson Institute for International Economics, discusses US inflation expectations with Bloomberg's Francine Lacqua in Sintra, Portugal. "These tariffs are already hitting the US auto industry," and adds that anti-migration policies in the US are also "inflationary, if not stagflationary." (Source: Bloomberg)
